body.p:
-Deya, Nov 10th 1958-
Dear William, Alastair's address at his next port of call is: Don
Quixote del Mar, C/O Commander Nicholson, English Harbour, Antigua, British
West Indies[*]. I don't know how long it will take him to get to New York
but you can get him in New York C/O Jess McNab, 86 Horatio Street, N.Y.C.14

With any luck you should get your sobrasada soon as the Pickstones
know someone who is driving back to England this week and I have given them
one to give him. If he takes it he will leave it with the Bevans's - people
we used to know in Barcelona and met again soon after you left for London.
He, Bernard Bevan is mentioned in the great mushroom book, and in
fact he was one of the first people to go to the Mexican tribe which
Wasson later wrote about. The joke was he didn't know that he was in the
book until he called on us at the very moment when we had that book on the
table and were showing it to Alastair's friend Alastair. Their address
is: 35, Elm Park Gardens, S.W.10. FLAX 4256. and this man who is taking the
sobrasada lives opposite them and will leave it with them - that is of
course, if the Pickstones find him to give it to him! I have put your
address on the packet so the Bevan's will probably get in touch with you if
etc.

Will see Pedro about the gloves today, and will post them as soon as.
Also the guitar things.

Juan has started his O level this month. Selby has left the school,
in fact he was asked not to return, and poor Abdullah has been expelled
as he found it impossible to conform to school rules and also give up
smoking[**]. By the way, did you ever get a pipe?
No more news, and I'm getting cold sitting here, typing!

Margins: Sorry to say I've just worked through your letters and can find
no mention of what you wanted for your guitar. Did I dream it or was it on
an envelope. Send a p.c. saying what & I'll airmail it.
